Mr. William G. Harley
President
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
1346 Connecticut Avenue N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20036
Dear Bill:
It is with pleasure that I inform you that the Corporation
has approved your request for funds to enable you to
relocate the facilities for the National Educational
Radio Network in Washington, D.C. This grant is made
in response to the proposal submitted to the Corporation
on January 23 by Robert Mott, Executive Director of
National Educational Radio.
In the proposal Mr. Mott detailed the total costs to
effect this relocation at $22,610. In further dis¬
cussion with Mr. Mott, he indicated that he felt his
cost estimates were accurate if indeed not conservative.
We therefore will grant up to this amount and it is
understood that if the total funds are not used during
the grant period of July 1, 1969 through June 30, 1970,
that the balance remaining will be returned to the Cor¬
poration. Since that is the case, I would suggest that
these funds be maintained by you in a separate account.
On July 1, 1969 I will send to you the Corporation's
check for the full amount of this grant. It is my
understanding that this move of the duplication facili¬
ties can be accomplished during a period of June 24
